text.text: Found this authentic mala hotpot in Singapore! We can select up to three different types of soup bases. Unlimited self-service of sides, sources, fruits, and snacks. Friendly staff, good service, and accommodating to our sitting request. The best thing is they space out the customers into different sections of the restaurant. This made the dining a lot more comfortable and not feeling cramped together.

This made the dining a lot more comfortable and not feeling cramped together.

text.text: Atmosphere is good and quiet. Nice ambient nice song.service is delicated that have initiated a special sauce they make to go along with the hotpot. Food is good and fresh. Portion is good tasteful lunch I had

text.text:
We had ordered the Seafood Platter at the Westgate outlet but however, the prawns were not fresh. The service staff Yan who served us is very helpful to our needs of topping up our soup, removal of the oily substances from our soup proactively.

Hope that there are more staffs like him. The service staff Yan had also make us feel welcomed at the restaurant by helping us taking photos from good angles.

text.text: Visited Xiao Long Kan and loved their homemade soup bases, simply incredible and tasty. From the fiery embrace of the Mala broth to the rich depth of flavour in the Pork Bones concoction, each sip is a revelation, some of the spices and aromas dancing on our palate. Their premium meat cuts and seafood are fresh, thick and juicy. We were greeted by a warm and inviting atmosphere. Their service was exceptionally good. I will return for a second visit soon.

originalText.text: Visited Xiao Long Kan and loved their homemade soup bases, simply incredible and tasty. From the fiery embrace of the Mala broth to the rich depth of flavour in the Pork Bones concoction, each sip is a revelation, some of the spices and aromas dancing on our palate. Their premium meat cuts and seafood are fresh, thick and juicy. We were greeted by a warm and inviting atmosphere. Their service was exceptionally good. I will return for a second visit soon.

text.text:
Any hotpot in Singapore that we Patronize, we can't help but compare to Haidilao.

Food: Crispy meat here definitely is better than Haidilao.
Beside crispy meat, the soup base, dessert Haidilao
is better.
Scallop and minced hand made prawn not much different
for both brands.

As for my friend who like spicy soup base mention, the spicy soup base here is better.

Service: Unlike Haidilao, a staff will in-charge few table to scoop
those "foam", we need to do it ourselves.
